column2: Quality of Patient Care Star Rating
column3: How often the home health team began their patients’ care in a timely manner
column4: How often the home health team taught patients (or their family caregivers) about their drugs
column5: How often the home health team checked patients’ risk of falling
column6: How often the home health team checked patients for depression
column7: How often the home health team determined whether patients received a flu shot for the currnet flu season
column8: How often the home health team made sure that their patients have received a pneumococcal vaccine (pneumonia shot)
column9: With diabetes, how often the home health team got doctor’s orders, gave foot care, and taught patients about foot care
column10: How often patients got better at walking or moving around
column11: How often patients got better at getting in and out of bed
column12: How often patients got better at bathing
column13: How often patients had less pain when moving around
column15: How often patients’ wounds improved or healed after an operation
column16: How often patients got better at taking their drugs correctly by mouth
column17: How often home health patients had to be admitted to the hospital
column18: How often patients receiving home health care needed urgent, unplanned care in the ER without being admitted
